oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Montgomery County Courthouse building damaged by a fire in 1900
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the Montgomery County Courthouse after the building was caught on fire on March 12, 1900.

On March 12, 1900, the Montgomery County Courthouse caught on fire, with the upper floors damaged and the clock tower destroyed. Some citizens wanted the building replaced, but the judge refused and ordered the damage was repaired.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Courthouses; Buildings; Government facilities; Clock towers; Fires
